background: A clinic produces batches of vitamin shots and pills, which require units of vitamins C and D. They aim to maximize the number of people supplied while adhering to the availability of vitamins and batch production limits.
constraints: Number of vitamin shot batches is non-negative
Number of vitamin pill batches is non-negative
Number of vitamin pill batches must be larger than the number of vitamin shot batches
Up to MaxShotBatches of vitamin shots can be made
objective: Maximize the total number of people that can be supplied with vitamin shots and pills
description: A clinic makes batches of vitamin shots and pills. Each batch of vitamin shots requires \param{VitaminCShot} units of vitamin C and \param{VitaminDShot} units of vitamin D. Each batch of vitamin pills requires \param{VitaminCPill} units of vitamin C and \param{VitaminDPill} units of vitamin D. Since pills are more popular, the number of batches of vitamin pills must be larger than the number of batches of vitamin shots. Further, the clinic can make at most \param{MaxShotBatches} batches of vitamin shots. The clinic has available \param{TotalVitaminC} units of vitamin C and \param{TotalVitaminD} units of vitamin D. If each batch of vitamin shots can supply \param{PeoplePerShot} people and each batch of vitamin pills can supply \param{PeoplePerPill} people, how many batches of each should be made to maximize the number of people that can be supplied?

parameters.definition: Units of vitamin C required for one batch of vitamin shots
Units of vitamin D required for one batch of vitamin shots
Units of vitamin C required for one batch of vitamin pills
Units of vitamin D required for one batch of vitamin pills
Maximum number of vitamin shot batches the clinic can make
Total available units of vitamin C
Total available units of vitamin D
Number of people supplied by one batch of vitamin shots
Number of people supplied by one batch of vitamin pills
